titles: The Whiggs lamentation, for the tap of sedition The tap 'tis stolen, the liquor fled be joyful then the Devil's dead.
notes: Verse - "Lament you Whiggs, you Presbyter priggs, your godfather Tony is dead: let Titus".
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
keywords: Political satire, English --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1660-1688 --  Early works to 1800.
